node.title: IT, trades help drive record number of job listings
node.description: A record number of job ads was posted on one of the country's leading labour market websites last month.

node.title: Organic wineries pin sales hopes on new China agreement
node.description: The Organic Exporters Association says an mutual recognition arrangement announced this week mean China now acknowledges New Zealand's organic standards.

node.title: 'Incredibly disturbing': Rising anti-media sentiment among protesters causing concern
node.description: The anti-mandate protests in Wellington and around the country have also contained a strong anti-media sentiment with reporters abused and threatened. Audio

node.title: Reports of sexual assault at U.S. military academies rose over the past year
node.description: The annual report on sexual assault at U.S. military academies released Thursday shows the highest number of sexual assault reports since the Pentagon began tracking the data.

node.title: Judge criticizes Justice Dept over plea deals in Jan. 6 prosecutions
node.description: Judge Beryl Howell says allowing those who stormed the Capitol to admit to petty crimes risks minimizing the attack.

node.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (February 20)
node.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the #1 Sunday morning news program

node.title: A work gap on your resumé is no longer a career killer
node.description: Because of the pandemic, interruptions in a person's work history don't necessarily spell doom for job seekers.

node.title: Anticipated Whangārei arts centre finally set to open
node.description: Whangārei's Hundertwasser Arts Centre will exhibit 80 works flown from Vienna when it opens on Sunday.

node.title: Wellington protest disrupts High Court trial
node.description: A criminal trial due to start on Monday has been adjourned because the defendant cannot get access to the High Court in Wellington. Audio

node.title: Former Angels employee convicted in Tyler Skaggs' overdose death
node.description: Eric Kay was convicted one count each of drug distribution resulting in death and drug conspiracy.

node.title: Former Florida deputy named probable suspect in 1983 rape and murder of young girl
node.description: Officials are unable to pursue charges against James Howard Harrison because he died in 2008.

node.title: British firm eyes Waikato for large solar farm
node.description: A British based company is proposing a large solar farm in eastern Waikato capable of powering 30,000 homes.

node.title: Injuries similar to "Havana Syndrome" cases reported on White House grounds
node.description: Senior national security officials say they were stricken with vertigo, confusion and memory loss both at home in Washington and on the grounds of the White House. 60 Minutes reports, Sunday.

node.title: More big companies are dropping vaccine requirement for workers
node.description: Adidas, Intel and Starbucks are among the major U.S. employers jettisoning rules ordering workers to get vaccinated.

node.title: Tesla faces safety probe of "phantom braking" of cars
node.description: Some 350 complaints by Tesla owners saying their cars can stop on roads for no apparent reason and they feared rear-end crashes on freeways.

node.title: 'Where was their shame decades ago?' - abuse survivors advocate
node.description: The Abuse in Care inquiry has heard the final submissions on its hearing into historical abuse at Marylands School in Christchurch.

node.title: Hallenstein Glassons sales plunge amid enforced Covid-19 closures
node.description: Clothing retailer Hallenstein Glassons earnings for the past six months have been savaged by the Covid-19 surges on both sides of the Tasman, forcing it to look for rent relief from landlords.

node.title: All members of Congress can attend State of the Union address, with restrictions
node.description: Members can't invite traditional guests and must test negative before the speech.

node.title: Appeal in Palin case unlikely to erode press protections, experts say
node.description: Two Supreme Court justices have called for it to revisit the landmark 1964 decision in New York Times v. Sullivan.

node.title: Trumps must testify in N.Y. fraud investigation, judge rules
node.description: The judge ordered the Trumps to appear for depositions within 21 days; their attorneys indicated they'll appeal.

node.title: Vermont parents charged with leaving child in car while they went skiing
node.description: Killington Police say both parents have been charged with cruelty to a child.

node.title: Virginia governor: Parents "best positioned" to decide if kids wear masks in school
node.description: The new law goes into effect on March 1.

node.title: Housing affordability at an all-time low - CoreLogic report
node.description: With the average property across New Zealand now costing 8.8 times the average household income, it would take households nearly 12 years to save for a deposit.

node.title: U.S. proposes limiting consideration of public benefits for green cards
node.description: The proposal is a stark departure from Trump-era public charge rules, which dramatically expanded the type and number of public benefits that would count against green card applicants.

node.title: Government Accountability Office says Capitol Police still need clearer steps for calling backup
node.description: The report said that on January 6, 2020, as the Capitol complex was overrun with rioters, Capitol Police struggled to secure outside backup due to obscure bureaucratic procedures.

node.title: Firefighters sue over protective gear, alleging it made them sick
node.description: Per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances, also known as PFAS, are found in the turnout gear that is designed to protect firefighters.

node.title: UK pledges $50 million to enhance security in Indo-Pacific
node.description: Britain has committed £25 million ($NZ50.7m) to strengthen security in the Indo-Pacific as part of a pact with Australia, and leaders of both countries expressed "grave concerns" about China's…

node.title: Mount Maunganui businesses struggle with staff shortages
node.description: Cafes and restaurants in Mount Maunganui are run off their feet as they wait for the return of backpackers on working holidays to ease their staffing crisis.

node.title: Top U.S. diplomat in Ukraine urges Americans to leave "now"
node.description: "The situation could worsen very quickly, and we're very worried about that and are urging all Americans to leave the country," Chargé d'Affaires Kristina Kvien told CBS News.

node.title: US, NATO say Russia is building up troops near Ukraine, not withdrawing
node.description: The US and NATO say Russia is still building up troops around Ukraine despite Moscow's insistence it is pulling back, questioning President Vladimir Putin's stated desire to negotiate a solution to…
